column4: Is there anyway to save login information when using openssh-server, or do I have to type the server name in everytime I connect?
Look up ssh keys. Specifically ssh-keygen
Yes. Set up a static assignment with your DHCPd.
Is this a WAN or LAN address?
how do I do that in 8.10?
Okay, no-ip/dyndns won't work then. They both block IANA private space.
I have static on my desktop running 8.04, but not on my laptop running 8.10
Static leases are controlled by the DHCPd. You'll want to configure it there. Alternatively, you can change your Ubuntu box to a static IP with system -> administration -> network in GNOME.
I would change it on the DHCPd (router) if possible, though. It's seamless.
Oh...I've never done that on a router
It just makes the router give certain IPs to certain mac addresses. Static DHCP leases.
Ok...I'm in the router...running Tomato firmware BTW
Ok..I found it on the router..under device list and I just clicked assign static iP...pretty easy
